menus.description: A rich, concentrated shot of coffee with a strong flavor.
Espresso diluted with hot water, smoother and milder in taste.
Espresso mixed with steamed milk and topped with light foam.
Equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam.
Espresso marked with a small amount of milk or foam.
Espresso mixed with chocolate syrup and steamed milk.
menus.origin: Yemen (Mocha Port), modern form from Italy/USA

menus.description: Espresso with smooth, velvety steamed milk and no foam.
Slow-brewed coffee made with cold water for a smooth taste.
Strong, unfiltered coffee boiled in a small pot (cezve).

teams.name: Christie Roure
teams.bio: Christie ensures every cup of coffee is brewed to perfection. With years of experience in coffee craft, she inspires our team to create unique flavors and a welcoming atmosphere.

teams.name: Guy Lassausaie
teams.bio: Guy loves crafting espresso and latte art. Passionate about sharing coffee stories, he makes every visit a special experience for our guests.

teams.name: Margarette Neva
teams.bio: Margarette provides warm and friendly service, making every customer feel at home. She brings energy and care to every table she serves.

teams.name: Camille Ozborne
teams.bio: Camille ensures smooth and cheerful service at the counter. She loves interacting with customers and sharing the joy of coffee.

blog.title: Article from Steve Harvey – “This Book Changed My Life”
blog.description: Analytics is often simply numbers and graphs. It’s easy to understand why some people are intimidated by analytics. But that doesn’t have to be the way. Analytics can be joyful and fun. It should help you take away the tedious work of dissecting graphs and calculating numbers. Analytics should feel like your assistant. With Analyze, you don’t just get charts. You’ll also see three recommended times to post on Instagram. They are times when  your predicted reach is among the highest during the week. Most people would find the three recommendations sufficient but if you want more, you can then dive into the charts.

blog.title: Time Article “Top Mistakes Really Smart People Make Without Realizing”
blog.description: Search “best time to post on Instagram” and you’ll find countless articles telling you when to post according to studies of a few million Instagram posts.  We have written such articles ourselves. For a long time, we thought that’s the way to grow our reach and engagement on social media.  But that is no longer the best approach.  There are many reasons for the change. Most importantly, you now have much more data about your own posts and followers. The best time to post is when your followers are online and engaging with your posts.  How do you know when to post?  Well, you can now get recommendations for when to post on Instagram to maximize your reach, with Analyze. Curious to find out more? Read on.
